dt: {bc}a line that marks the outer limits of an object or figure {bc}{sx|boundary||}
{bc}a style of drawing in which contours are marked without shading

dt.t: prepared several {wi}outlines{/wi} of the suggested mural

dt: {bc}a condensed treatment of a particular subject

dt.t: Students were required to give an {wi}outline{/wi} for each assigned paper.
gave the class an {wi}outline{/wi} of the points he intended to cover

pt: {sc}outline{/sc} {sc}contour{/sc} {sc}profile{/sc} {sc}silhouette{/sc} mean the line that bounds and gives form to something. {sc}outline{/sc} applies to a line marking the outer limits or edges of a body or mass.
{sc}contour{/sc} stresses the quality of an outline or a bounding surface as being smooth, jagged, curving, or sharply angled.
{sc}profile{/sc} suggests a varied and sharply defined outline against a lighter background.

pt.t: a portrait of her face in {it}profile{/it}

pt: {sc}silhouette{/sc} suggests a shape especially of a head or figure with all detail blacked out in shadow leaving only the outline clearly defined.

pt.t: photograph in {it}silhouette{/it} against a bright sky

shortdef: a line that marks the outer limits of an object or figure : boundary
a style of drawing in which contours are marked without shading

dt: {bc}to indicate the principal features or different parts of

shortdef: to indicate the principal features or different parts of

dt: {bc}beyond what is reasonable or allowable {bc}not right or appropriate

dt.t: These prices are way {it}out of line{/it}.

shortdef: beyond what is reasonable or allowable : not right or appropriate

dt.t: If you {it}step out of line{/it}, you'll get kicked off the bus.

shortdef: to disobey rules or behave badly
